name: farina
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of flour popular in the US, made from wheat or sometimes other plants, that is slightly coarser (= thicker) than normal flour: Try cooking cornmeal, farina, or any cereal in stock instead of water. Eat hot cereals, like porridge or wheat farina when recovering from illness.
More examplesFewer examplesFarina is a bland-tasting meal, finer than semolina, that makes a hot breakfast cereal when cooked in boiling water.Farina dumplings are firmer than the kind made with ordinary flour.Clean the spring onions, then chop them very fine, until they reach the consistency of farina. Sprinkle the dough with a teaspoon of chickpea farina before baking.
